definition: to flow right off the tongue (of lyrics or poetry)/to recite with ease/catchy (of a song)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: It helps them memorize the months with a catchy rhyme.
sentences.chinese: 它以朗朗上口的韵脚来帮助他们记起月份。

sentences.english: Words were usually repeated in his article, which make it easy to read.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章中经常出现重言，读来朗朗上口。

sentences.english: Come up with a catchy logo for it that I have to approve.
sentences.chinese: 想出了一个为它朗朗上口的标志，我已批准。

sentences.english: They may also pick up foreign languages more easily than others.
sentences.chinese: 他们比其他人更容易学习外语，很快就能朗朗上口。

sentences.english: Give your show a catchy title.
sentences.chinese: 给你的节目取个朗朗上口的名字。

sentences.english: After that let the students give orders and the teacher does the actions.
sentences.chinese: 学生用英语表达，使学生对所学单词朗朗上口。

definition: to rhyme/sometimes written 壓韻|压韵
popular piece of doggerel/common phrase repeated as a jingle
